clips.speaker: Doctor
clips.text: Good morning, how are you feeling today?

clips.speaker: Patient
clips.text: I've been having chest pain for the past two days.

clips.speaker: Doctor
clips.text: Can you describe the pain? Is it sharp or dull?

clips.speaker: Patient
clips.text: It's a sharp pain that comes and goes, especially when I take deep breaths.

clips.speaker: Doctor
clips.text: Have you experienced any shortness of breath or dizziness?

clips.speaker: Patient
clips.text: Yes, I feel a bit short of breath, especially when climbing stairs.

clips.speaker: Doctor
clips.text: I recommend we do an ECG and chest X-ray to rule out any cardiac issues.

clips.speaker: Patient
clips.text: Okay, that sounds good. Should I be worried?

clips.speaker: Doctor
clips.text: Let's get the tests done first, but try to avoid strenuous activities for now. Any current medications or kidney problems?

clips.speaker: Patient
clips.text: Just blood pressure pills, and my kidneys are a bit weak.

clips.speaker: Doctor
clips.text: I'll prescribe paracetamol 1000mg every 6 hours for pain. Safe with your medications.
